TopicTitle: [1.8.x] CapCom - Mission Control On The Go [v2.11] [11-1-2019]

Articles.Content:
Hi ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

After accepting the last available contract, i'm getting a NullReferenceException (replicable):

    NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
      at CapCom.CapComWindow+<>c.b__67_0 (ContractParser.contractContainer c) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at System.Linq.Enumerable.Any[contractContainer] (IEnumerable`1 source, System.Func`2 predicate) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at CapCom.CapComWindow.currentContractControls (Int32 id) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at CapCom.CapComWindow.DrawWindow (Int32 id) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at CapCom.Framework.CC_MBW.DrawWindowInternal (Int32 id) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at UnityEngine.GUILayout+LayoutedWindow.DoWindow (Int32 windowID) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at UnityEngine.GUI.CallWindowDelegate (UnityEngine.WindowFunction func, Int32 id, Int32 instanceID, UnityEngine.GUISkin _skin, Int32 forceRect, Single width, Single height, UnityEngine.GUIStyle style) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0

It doesnt "break" anything but you may want to take a look at this. The exception only occurs when accepting the last available contract via capcom, not when accpeting it via mission control building.

KSP version is 1.4.2, CapCom v.2.8 and no other contract related mod/contract pack is installed.

Is there a way to modify the max number of contracts per difficulty?

I love this mod, but the random timing of the offered contracts has caused issues with the max amount of contracts I can accept.  (Especially when using community contracts.)

Example: I getting close to the Duna transfer window (34 days out).  I have 4x level 3 contracts already for setting up com networks, station, etc.  I then get a ScanSat contract for Duna, but cant accept it due to the max contracts being met (and it expires in 5 days).

Outside of going into the save, I am left with no option to acquire these contracts.

FYI:  My buildings are fully upgraded, so there is no base game limitation being applied.

CapCom version 2.9 is out; get it on [Space Dock](https://spacedock.info/mod/131/CapCom%20-%20Mission%20Control%20On%20The%20Go).

It is updated for KSP 1.4.5 and for version 10 of Progress Parser. Only versions 1.4.4 and 1.4.5 of KSP are supported.

This fixes some errors that causes a lot of log spam to be generated whenever a scene was loaded. It also ensures that the progress logs for discovering anomalies will display correctly.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-07-30T20:48:33Z" title="07/30/2018 08:48  PM" data-short="5 yr">July 30, 2018</time> by DMagic**

Version 2.10 is out; get it on [Space Dock](https://spacedock.info/mod/131/CapCom%20-%20Mission%20Control%20On%20The%20Go).

This fixes a minor issue that could cause the controls to become locked when closing the settings window.

It is built for KSP 1.4.5, but everything seems to be working fine for KSP 1.5.
the version file is still marked as 1.2.9. so it spoofs avc into thinking its still out of date.

[@<abbr title="Center of Lift">COL</abbr>.R.Neville](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/168067-colrneville/) Where are you getting the file from? I see 1.2.10 in the .version file from GitHub, Curse, and Space Dock, and I think <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> has been updated as well. The .version file on GitHub is also marked for 1.2.10 and KSP 1.5.

The included dependencies have not been updated for KSP 1.5, so their local .version files are still marked for KSP 1.4, but the remote files on GitHub have been updated to show KSP 1.5 support.
i used the download link that pops up from avc. I think it was space dock. I just dl'ed it again and it does say 1.2.10 now.

There is one thing I would love to see for this. Love this BTW. But....there is no way to associate flights with contracts. Cant think of anyway to "pin" a contract to a given flight. Which would be very cool but I would be pretty happy if I could just attach a note to a contract so I could at least write the ship name Im using for a given contract. No clue how hard it is to do such things or if its even possible. Or maybe there is something already that does this? Just an idea that popped in my head while I was trying to deal with which contracts I have not started yet and which goes where. Anyone else ever get confused about which is where?

[@Kevin Kyle](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/110492-kevin-kyle/) That is more in line with what Contracts Window + does. CapCom is basically just an alternative to the Mission Control center that can be accessed from other scenes.

Contracts Window + allows you to group contracts together into lists, and will save which list a vessel was using when you save/change scenes.

Guess I better dig into + then and fix the mess I got going. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") I hadnt really associated what that does with what I need. Love your stuff BTW, thanks for all you do.

Hi and thanks for the mod!

I want to install this mod via <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr>, but Progress Parser and Contract Parser works only with 1.6.8.  

Can I force <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> to install in my 17.3 version without break anything? Any of you experienced any issue?

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, RedDragon91GoW said:
> 
> 
> Hi and thanks for the mod!
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I want to install this mod via <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr>, but Progress Parser and Contract Parser works only with 1.6.8.  
> 
> Can I force <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> to install in my 17.3 version without break anything? Any of you experienced any issue?
> 

In the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> client, go to

Settings > Compatible KSP versions

and check "1.7" and "1.6".

**Edited <time datetime="2019-10-26T02:36:37Z" title="10/26/2019 02:36  AM" data-short="4 yr">October 26, 2019</time> by Brigadier**

CapCom version 2.11 is out; get it on [Space Dock](https://spacedock.info/mod/131/CapCom%20-%20Mission%20Control%20On%20The%20Go).

It has been update to support KSP 1.8.

Its dependencies Progress Parser and Contract Parser have also been updated and are included in the download package.
Thanks, really been missing this in my game.

Hi [@DMagic](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57416-dmagic/),

Thank you for making this great mod. I think this mod helps the best when you can select the contract in tracking station so you can get the visual info directly.

I noticed that when open capcom in tracking station with fully upgrade mission control center (8/6/4 contracts max) it will still showing contract limit of level 2 mission control (5/3/1 contracts max).

Please help.
